title: bash run.sh gives RuntimeError: The size of tensor a (5000) must match the size of tensor b (2312) at non-singleton dimension 0
body:
Hi @foolwood, thank you very much for your great work, I can successfully run demo and VOT test, however when I run training script of base siammask model with commend "**bash run.sh**",  it gave the error message:
[2019-07-29 21:26:06,194-rk0-train_siammask.py#166] model prepare done
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/aiserver/fangyang/SiamMask/SiamMask-master/tools/train_siammask.py", line 292, in <module>
    main()
  File "/home/aiserver/fangyang/SiamMask/SiamMask-master/tools/train_siammask.py", line 168, in main
    train(train_loader, dist_model, optimizer, lr_scheduler, args.start_epoch, cfg)
  File "/home/aiserver/fangyang/SiamMask/SiamMask-master/tools/train_siammask.py", line 236, in train
    outputs = model(x)
  File "/home/aiserver/fangyang/anaconda3/envs/siammask-tracker/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 477, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/aiserver/fangyang/anaconda3/envs/siammask-tracker/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/parallel/data_parallel.py", line 124, in forward
    outputs = self.parallel_apply(replicas, inputs, kwargs)
  File "/home/aiserver/fangyang/anaconda3/envs/siammask-tracker/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/parallel/data_parallel.py", line 134, in parallel_apply
    return parallel_apply(replicas, inputs, kwargs, self.device_ids[:len(replicas)])
  File "/home/aiserver/fangyang/anaconda3/envs/siammask-tracker/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/parallel/parallel_apply.py", line 77, in parallel_apply
    raise output
  File "/home/aiserver/fangyang/anaconda3/envs/siammask-tracker/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/parallel/parallel_apply.py", line 53, in _worker
    output = module(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/aiserver/fangyang/anaconda3/envs/siammask-tracker/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 477, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/aiserver/fangyang/SiamMask/SiamMask-master/models/siammask_sharp.py", line 97, in forward
    self.run(template, search, softmax=self.training)
  File "/home/aiserver/fangyang/SiamMask/SiamMask-master/models/siammask_sharp.py", line 65, in run
    rpn_pred_mask = self.refine_model(feature, corr_feature)
  File "/home/aiserver/fangyang/anaconda3/envs/siammask-tracker/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 477, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/aiserver/fangyang/SiamMask/SiamMask-master/experiments/siammask_sharp/custom.py", line 150, in forward
    **out = self.post0(F.upsample(self.h2(out) + self.v2(p2), size=(31, 31)))
RuntimeError: The size of tensor a (5000) must match the size of tensor b (2312) at non-singleton dimension 0**
test snapshot 1 /root 20 on dataset VOT2016 with 2 gpus.
[2019-07-29 21:26:48,783-rk0-test.py#555] Namespace(arch='Custom', config='config.json', cpu=False, dataset='VOT2016', debug=False, gt=False, log='log_test.txt', mask=True, refine=False, resume='snapshot/checkpoint_e13.pth', save_mask=False, video='', visualization=False).......

Could you give me a help? Looking for your reply, thanks!
